one_reviews_text: quite apptly named, this platformer game with horrible fixed camera positions coupled with horrible inaccurate movement will require a lot of luck to pass, let alone collect all the collectibles on your way. want to make a small step on a tiny platform? sorry, our psychotic fox will lunge forward and fall into the water! DO NOT BUY.

I have not had as much fun in a platformer since Mario 64.  Lucky's Tale is a great platformer that is easy to play and makes full use of VR. You will be running, jumping and collecting coins all well taking out the bad guys. This game feels great, its like you are in a chair floating in Lucky's world controlling him. Must play for any platform lover. My only downer about the game, is its not cross buy. Now I have to buy it again for my Quest to play on the go.

I have played this on my friends Oculas Rift back when the game lauched and I was hooked. Years later when after playing Super Lucky's Tale and "New" Super Lucky's Tale, I finally bought an Oculas Quest 2 and this was the first game I wanted to play. I was pleased that I am able to play this Gem and actually finish the game on my Quest 2. Very pleased that AirLink allowed me to stream this from my PC to the headset. This is a must buy game for anyone that likes platformers. I would love to have a Mario game that is as immersive as this game is.

review_title: Please do a Quest port or continuation!
one_reviews_text: Playing this game gives you such a joyful feeling! Being released in 2016 Lucky's Tale is an early VR game but still 5 years later it's a TON of fun and is so wonderful and colorful. I would love if Lucky would someday return to his VR roots, however. The Quest 2 has sold more units than every previous Oculus headset combined. I can understand in 2017 making the sequel non-VR but in 2021 there's a MUCH larger market for VR, especially on Quest. Oh developers of the wonderful Lucky's Tale, please bring Lucky back to his roots someday! I haven't played the non-VR sequel so I don't know how feasible it would be on the Quest but with the Quest a success it should be looked into! Thank you for creating such an awesome game that still holds up years later! :D

review_title: Great game works well with Air Link.
one_reviews_text: Great looking game this hidden gem is fantastic with the new Quest Air Link the controls work great!!!

review_title: Love to see this game come to Quest
one_reviews_text: I have enjoyed this game since the first demonstration on the Oculus Rift DK2 and I really hope the devs did not abandon VR. It would be great to see Lucky back on the Quest. If you have never played Lucky and you are a fan of platformer games this is a must have! Lucky's Tale is one of the platform games availble for Rift.

This game is not new. I got it when i first bought Rift CV1. Now with Quest2 it really shines. Simple but beautiful graphics and great ideas for oponents, mechanizms etc makes it really unique experience. If you remember games like Super Mario you will for sure love it!

review_title: One of the best platform games
one_reviews_text: I think, the astrobots stole many of the best parts from that game. It looks very nice, and it's immersive. It could be a bit longer and after a time it turns to be monotonic for me, but it still an amazing platform game...
Quest support would be fantastic
Nothing outstanding in it, and it just makes we want A Hat in Time or a Mario in vr. I'm giving it 5 stars because it's very polished for a VR game and pretty fun.

So my daughter was obsessed with this game literally the only VR game she would play for awhile so I gave it a try and I have to admit it's very fun. The third person veiw from high up really let's you admire the landscapes adding a perspective of immersion old platformers just can't deliver. Great for people who might experience motion sickness in games with first person pov. Plus they allow you to use your touch controller as a gamepad Wich is always a win in my eyes!

review_title: One of the best VR games ever!
one_reviews_text: It´s a Mixture beetween Mário 64 , Little big Planet, it´s colourfull and do not need  high specs to run cool.
It is a good game that I have played and loved since I was 8! Now I am thirteen and almost fourteen and it it is still one of my favourite games!
For me is a surprise this game! The section in 2.5d is also a very impressive. No sickness for me and 30 minute a days is ok.

Once you get past the somewhat intro that's clearly aimed at children game turns out to be cracking little platform coin collector. Yes, its a blantant rip off of Mario with even some hint of Sonic, but so what? 

The envirnoment is far from Hi res, think cartoony cell shaded graphics but i think this just adds to the atmosphere. This isnt a game to take too seriously, its a game i dip into to warm up with.

The gameplay and mechanics are super smooth and responsive its, easy to get into a flow and a rhythm and the very simple 'combat' is  all you need with basically two moves. Each level can be played through three times, story mode, Red coin collection and speed runs.  This gives the game real replay value and i think makes it a cracking bargain.

Look past the some of the aspects that are certainly aimed at children and there is plenty of fun to be had here. The difficulty generally increases as you progress, hardcore platform gamers may find it a little easy but as an average gamer, some of the levels took a couple of attempts and several lives to complete.

This isnt quite on the same level as Moss but treat it as a casual arcade style platfomer and you wont be disappointed.

review_title: The best VR platform game out there
one_reviews_text:
Amazing colourful and cute world, good graphics, fun gameplay and a comfortable VR experience.
A great VR surprise for me because I thought that VR was better for First Person games, but this one proves to be wrong.
Pretty fun.  Enjoyed more than I thought I would.  =)

review_title: Really enjoyable for a free game
one_reviews_text:
It had some problems with the audio engine switching off sometimes but it's just the perfect game to let off some steam at the end of the day. The awesome art and animations give a lighthearted touch to the experience. Would suggest to anyone who owns an Oculus.
Another problem that I should report is that the camera doesn't always follow the player and the controls feel a bit uncomfortable in some parts (like when I need to walk down a narrow path I always tend to fall because I don't get the orientation right).
very hard and bad...although lucky is cute.

It might not be the best platformer I have ever played but it is thoroughly enjoyable experience. The added depth of VR works perfectly well in this genre and diorama feeling to some levels is incredible.

This game takes a lot of its cues from Nintendo platformers and it makes for a wonderful cartoon experience. Loads of interesting worlds, camera controls and fun level design will keep you coming back.

The collectibles are moderately challenging which gives the game some replay value. I would LOVE to see the sequel Super Lucky's Tale make the transition to VR but until then I'll get it on the Switch.

review_title: Im sorry but not my game...
one_reviews_text: This game was a little bit too bright, and I think it's just another one of those mario-like games. I got bored very fast.

Considering it's a free game, I have to give it some slack. Everybody has to start somewhere with a free VR game when they just get a system. This is my frist download outside of the Oculus home world. And I have t osay that I think it's really boring and basic. I mean, it's great that these worlds can look so cool, but this is just a really generic platformer that does nothing to innovate despite the 3D invironment. You can even "interact" with the character by "touching" him, but that's even lame. You just get close to him and get does 1/3 preset animations. No touching or physics or any interaction to the player. I do like some of the perspectives, but art means nothing when the game is boring. I'm not the biggest platformer fan, but platformers did good back in the day because each one had their own innivations. This one has nothing besides the VR gimic. It's a free game that's worth a try if you like the genre. But I can't really say I enjoyed it outside of the first 20 minutes.

For the squeemish make sure to play in short increments though as the camera pans freely with Lucky and can cause discomfort. Absolutely worth the effort though. My only regret is that Super Lucky's Tale is not available for VR also but I look forward to playing Star Child on day one.
This is a must have game for your rift. I consider this the Mario of Oculus. I really hope i have more lucky to look forward to.

This is a simple, honest, but polished platforming game where the VR element is your camera is following your character around the 3D stage. A very friendly game to be sure, one you can play sitting down, and one I'd recommend playing with a gamepad.

So maybe I'm still in the honeymoon phase (got my Oculus 2 days ago) but this is just a great little game.  Sharp graphics, cute music and mannerisms (shoo shoo shoo!)  or when Lucky actually shields his eyes when your headset lamp shines in his face (which made me realize I HAD a headset lamp when underground -- awesome).

Remember when you first played Mario 64 and thought WOW!  Well, that's this game.  I'm only on level 2, so I'm not sure how much longevity it has, but I really like it just for the graphics and gameplay -- how it looks like you're watching a model world come alive, how you can look around things (like BEHIND the rafters when underground for coins), etc.

Also, apparently I have a stomach of steel or something, I haven't gotten the least bit sick with this (or any other app for that matter). To those getting sick, try chewing on ginger root to see if it helps, as it's a common natural remedy for those with extreme motion sickness.

review_title: A Solid Platformer Lacking in Variety
one_reviews_text:
Lucky's Tale is a solid platformer with tight and responsive controls.  Lucky handles exactly the way you'd expect him to in every situation making the game incredibly easy to pick up and play: it's the same kind of tight controls you'd expect in a Nintendo-made platformer.  The game also looks great: unlike the similar Super Mario 3D World/Land, the levels look like you're actually traveling through a world instead of a bunch of platforms floating in the sky.


Unfortunately, the game feels very much like the developer was testing the waters with the VR platformer concept.  It's very short: I beat the main story in less than two hours without even trying to rush.  There's some extra challenges for replayability but I'd prefer a longer length.  Also, the environments and enemies lack variety.  You've seen most of the enemies in the game by the end of the second world and the environments lack variety: the first half of the game mostly takes place in woods and the second half mostly in ruins.  There's a couple of slight twists on these environments in a couple of levels, but it's not enough to stop the sameness creeping in.


It's a good debut game and I really wish the sequel were in VR as it would give me more incentive to try it to see if it fixed my issues.

review_title: It's just a platformer with a gamepad.
one_reviews_text:
Sure, it's neat that it's in 3D, but that's all it has going for it. The gameplay isn't interesting in the slightest. You run around and collect coins. Been there, done that with other games that have done it far better.

If you removed virtual reality, it would be exactly the same game, and so much more boring. VR adds nothing.

This game has a lot of potential to be.. pretty fun.

It seemed cool at first, but the moment the camera starts moving on its own it's an instant trip to barf city for me. No camera options as far as I can tell either. Since the camera is moving around the level, there's little point of reference to look at (unless you look away from where the action is). Watch out if you're sensitive to that I guess. review_title: A cool take on VR platforming
one_reviews_text: I really like the style and detail the artists and animators put into the game, and the gameplay presents a novel and enjoyable approach to 3D platformer mechanics in VR. I found the game itself to be a bit too simple (I understand it's aimed more at kids) and the camera motion got to be a little unpleasant at times. Overall, however, a good title to have in one's VR collection!

one_reviews_text: Well, first I have to say that the fox is adorable, but putting apart this important point, I want to say that this game is totally awesome, maybe easy but taking into account that is also for kids this is not a problem. As I said in the topic: is the best VRplatform right now for Oculus, the graphics are very solid, the music is very good for this kind of games, the levels are very beautiful and there are very enjoyable to play. This is a decent platformer game and would have been enjoyable (albeit uninspired) had it not been made for VR. The problem I had was that the game uses a floating camera that moves automatically, it's very jarring and made me nauseous and dizzy almost immediately. I even almost lost my footing. No other VR games have caused me any discomfort outside of excessively long  play sessions. I couldn't play this game for more than about five minutes at a time without seriously making myself sick. It’s a shame too because I believe that a lot of effort went in to this game, the art, music, and controls are all nice, but that work goes to waste when the game itself is this uncomfortable to play.

The VR expierence is pretty low too, because this game was not made to be VR. There are only a few thing which looks pretty cool in VR like the main menu where u select levels.
Furthermore you should not play it when you get motion sickness as easy as me. I can only play it for a few minutes, even tho the camera moves pretty slow. 
So well if you like such jump and runs, you should buy it. But I think this game is pretty boring.

This game is... I'm not sure where to start, really. It would have been okay if it wasn't VR, for starters. As it IS VR, the way the camera works and can't be controlled, and moves to its own groove, makes me sick faster than any vehicle game. This is the reason I have a pack of ginger gum on my desk, and while it seems to help with others, does NOTHING for this game. The headache and nausea take about five minutes to manifest at an unbearable level.

The gameplay would be fine with a standard controller outside of VR, but the mechanics of the 3D and camera interaction mean you're forced to take all sorts of weird actions that make the motion-sick even worse, in a game that, again, would have been okay in a 2.5D sidescrolling platformer, Crash Bandicoot-style.

As I couldn't play it for more than a few minutes, I can't give a story rating, because it's just that bad.

You guys could have had just about any other game bundled with it, but you went with this. The bundled game is supposed to demonstrate the capabilities. The fun. Get someone happy about their purchase and eager for more, rather than looking to pawn off the system on someone else. 

Lone Echo is amazing. Elevator to the Moon is pretty good. I Expect You To Die is great too. Now... I understand the difficulties in selling the motion controllers and the headset separately, but use something like Obduction, or another exploration game, not something that throws the players into the deep-end of physical endurance.

I thought this game was actually a short film, similar to Henry or Invasion.
Well, turns out it's a 3D platformer that plays like Super Mario 64/Odyssey, but for a younger audience (bad comparison, but it's all I can think of).

And the levels are well thought. I found a lot of fun with it. Good work Oculus!
This game is amazing.  Many levels, much variety, very immersive.
THIS IS SO FRIGGIN COOL! IMMERSION LV. MASTER!
This game is so cool and simple but VR just makes it awesome. I wish more 3D platforms like this one come out!

I was expecting something different from a platformer in vr. Instead, I got this game. It is literally a platofrmer but in vr, nothing different except the fact that it just doesn't feel like it should've been a vr game. This may be different for some people, but it felt weird to play, but not gameplay wise. I mean I had to take off my headset and uninstall it.

The game came with my Oculus, but it will not start. I get an error message that gives me the location of a log and tells me to inform the developers, but doesn't tell me how. I've made efforts to contact them for over 3 weeks now. I've tried emailing the company, contacting them via Twitter, and contacting them via Facebook. The closest thing I've received to a response was from the Super Lucky's Tale Facebook page telling me that Super Lucky's Tale was a different game (same company), but gave me no info to help me. The company couldn't care less about their customers. Hopefully I can convince Oculus to let me relinquish it for a game that gives a flip about its customers.
Nice gamne
Nice!!
asfedshdfj
Lucky is still one of my all time fav VR games. Hope they bring part 2 to the Rift as well.
Good app to play,.

This game really helped show me that this type of game can really work well in VR. The main character is likable and the levels are gorgeous looking. I just wish it would have been more difficult with maybe some RPG elements, like unlockable moves for beating a boss.
Enjoyed

VR really makes this game.  If they make a sequal I think it would be great if they could work in some kind of coop play.  I really enjoyed the story book style environment and characters.  A nice casual game that you can just sit in your chair and play.
test

The game looks nice and has responsive controls, but I found the gameplay exceptionally boring. It felt like the same thing over and over again level after level without anything new between the levels.

If your not one of these soft wimpy people who get motion sickness walking down the stairs too quickly, this game is wicked. I first thought it was a little kids game (especialy with the opening scene) but I quickly loved it once the game play started. Easy enough to run through for a beginner but hard enough to keep you entertained. If you can get it for free like I did at least try it! I would have paid for it for sure.

review_title: Good idea; although don't need VR
one_reviews_text:
The game is fun to play; cartoonish and with interesting environments, although the controls are a bit off in some instances; and VR in general is not really useful, beside being a gimmick.

The protagonist moves around 3d worlds that are a bit cramped but serve their purpose; fundamentally it is a mix between crash bandicoot and Gex; if you remember them, but it works nicely and the game is fun to play.

The game is epic, the best part are the time trials, but getting gold on time trial is just unfair. I have played sunken city a thousand times. Still no way to get it. Either get rid of those stupid crystal time penalties or increase the time.

review_title: Good but not becuase of VR
one_reviews_text:
This isn't my type of game normally, but it came free with the rift so gave it a go.
It's fun, the sound and graphics all good, the controls instinctual and easy to master.
BUT 
It's not really a VR experience I can see it being just as much fun in 2D.
Such a good game and I think the VR makes the experience some really good moments - Disagree with some saying the VR makes no difference to the game it does and it makes it come to life 5 stars

review_title: A perfect introduction to VR platforming
one_reviews_text:
I got this when I got the Rift and I was just blown away by the graphics the first time I experienced it. I described it to a friend as someone creating a wonderful theme park ride all around you which you get to explore and play around in. 

The platforming is quite basic, it's no Mario Bros but it certainly has its charm and most importantly, it proves that platforming has a place in the VR landscape! 

The controls are spot-on, the music and the colors are delightful and the hub areas and the secret levels look especially wonderful. 

There is a lot of replay value, coins to be collected, time challenges to be bested, but I can't see myself going back to those with the lack of variation in gameplay. But the main game itself is nothing short of wonderful. Highly recommened, especially if you want to see how a platform game would work (and it really works!) in VR!
mario whit a tail...
blast to n64

review_title: Like Being Inside Super Mario 3D Land
one_reviews_text: Its basically a re-skinned Super Mario, and I mean that as a huge compliment. The levels are long, and well designed, and there are little innovative set pieces thrown in along the way to keep things fresh. Its one of the best things I've played so far on the Rift.

Besides the motion sickness, if you're standing, this game is the "Super Mario Bros" for VR, but with the advantages that only can be built into a VR game. Such as looking around for hidden things, seeing different parts of the level as you pass by, etc. Highly recommended for young children (5-10). No gore, bad language, etc.

review_title: The mother of future platform gaming!
one_reviews_text: I'd easily rate this game at 95% (98% only goes to Lone Echo). Forget Mario, Sonic the Hedgehog etc., nothing - and I do mean nothing - beats this game within it's genre. It's the combination of awesome gameplay and great graphics in VR. I've never dreamt I'd experience platform games like this - feels like in the 1982 when I was 8 or 9 years old and saw the first great arcade machines. Thanks Oculus! BTW, the game runs perfect with supersampling at 2.0 on my GTX 1080 + i7 7700k, and works great with Touch controls. PS. I never felt any motion sickness, so unless you're prone to motion sickness in a lot of VR games I wouldn't worry about it :-)
Not really my type of game but the cuteness level is through the roof. Perfect for kids. If someone asks me how long I played this game, I would tell them that I'll take the fifth on that one. ;)
Very well made game, looks and plays great.

review_title: was iffy at first, but its grown on me
one_reviews_text:
when i first tried this game i got a bit motion sick, which surprised me, and continues to surprise me that it isn't mentioned more often. 

i was also reluctant about the idea of playing a third-person game in vr (why not just play it on your pc, it's not like you'll be looking around much...) and although i haven't played this game as much as the others, it is a pretty cool experience, the game is cute, and if you're into the idea of a third person platformer vr, then you'll probably like it.
Not my cup of tea, but it showed me that platformers work in VR.

This is a great way of showing what VR can do with platform games. If it was a normal game on a console I would say its kind of boring and limited. But the VR camera adds depth to the experience. Put this same tech in a really well done platform game and it would be a truely amazing thing to see.
This is an awesome game, DOWNLOAD!
that would only be average without VR. But it's really comfy to play for first timers and I like the art style a lot!
I really love the look and feel of this game, however it did take me a while to get over the motion. After I got use to motion I found it fun, and a bit of a chalange.
please make luckies tail 2
Incredible experience

The platformer is a pretty nice introduction into vr. Can't hate, because it's free, and it plays the way it's supposed to. However, the game is too easy for my taste. Maybe some kind of wave/challenge mode would make it even more interesting.

I had some fun with the game and I got it free, but I only played for maybe an hour and uninstalled it. I somewhat enjoy platformers but I'm not a big fan and I didn't feel that VR added too much but it added a little something.

Such a basic but classic concept not unlike Mario, Sonic or Crash Bandicoot, and will bring alot of casual gamers to VR and is a first step in passive games such as this. I recommend Farlands or Tethered for a similar VR feel but with a different gameplay.

Lucky's Tale isn't the time of game that is really suited for VR, but it is still kind of fun to play. The movements are simple, but it can be a little hard to control at times when you are trying to move the character while your vision is moving at the same time. There are annoying factors, like when Lucky pretends to lose his balance. The UI is frustrating too. There doesn't seem to be an easy way to exit, and you have to find your place in the story every time.
great game loved it

review_title: Cute good graphics for kids and adults!
one_reviews_text:
Recommended experience!
+: Good basic game so far with pleasant and detailed graphics.
+: Interesting and effective way to display game level in 3D.

=: Visuals make you regret that Nintendo did not make Mario (and other games) on PC in addition to consoles.

-: Camera and view angle reset could be better.
-: While technically more realistic, the fluidity of movement after jumping could be better to allow player to control their descent.

Nice fun game, but this game bug (~5-10min) and oculus isn't detect, i need to restart computer to play again (restart services dont change anything)
UP: update driver, problem solved
I love this game and can play it all day long.
its realy the best

This game cemented my love of VR for platformers. It's so well made, so polished, and playable. Over the past year, I've been playing the Quest more often as I'm free to take it to larger parts of the house; so so so so wish I could take this game with me on Quest. Still playing it on Rift no matter what.

i accidentily set the default language to korean and i cant work out how to change it back to english i consider this game to be 5 stars but until i can change the language settings ill stick with 1 star

I loved the concept. It was like reading a much more interactive story book! The graphics are great and the concept is wonderful for a platformer! I don't normally enjoy platformers, but this is something I can get behind.

I really dislike platformers but... this is fun :) 
Gave it a shot since it's in the game library and had a good time so far. 
Would recommend to everyone, even if you don't like these types of games normally.
Also, if you have kids, I'm sure they'll love this one too

Why are you reading a review for a free game.
Just get it and try for yourself
If you ever had a motion sickness – don't even try this. Who came up with the idea of making a 3rd-side-view platformer for vr???

Very cutesy game with fun mechanics and very clean graphics. I found the easiest/most enjoyable way to play is sitting on the floor... gets you right in on the action and really adds to the immersion. It really highlights what will be possible with other big name titles like Mario, Zelda, etc in the future... I hope we see some cross platform compatibility and can play classic platformers in this format. Worth it!!

well i think this would make a awesome normal playstation or xbox game, but VR nah its just weird how your standing in a world where the ground is in your body and your a giant standing acwardly just there
Great Experience.. 3rd person works very well in VR.

review_title: The Best TPP VR Game yet!
one_reviews_text: Visual and gameplay on high level. Must have.

review_title: Of all the games to cause sickness...
one_reviews_text:
I may have only had my VR device for two days, but I'm no stranger to the platform.  I've been playing for about a year now, first with a borrowed GearVR device (I had plenty of fun with fan ports of Quake with joystick locomotion and high speeds) then with RiftCat on a cheap Cardboard headset.  From Redout, to bhopping in Quake, to Minecraft, nothing ever gave me nausea without an extended period of play and framerate drops to finish the job.

This game, however... it started out with so much promise.  The platforming mechanics feel great.  The controls for Oculus Touch work are well thought out.  The environments look brilliant, with a nice aesthetic and a good backdrop to look around.  However, the moment I approached the edge of the camera my praise for the game ended.

This game has THE worst camera I have EVER seen in a VR game.  It has a smooth motion, no visual references (e.g. a floating platform with guardrails that you could be standing on), and no control whatsoever.  Perhaps I could grit my teeth if I were sitting down, but even then the feeling of smoothed motion that is entirely out of your hands... I was feeling sick in mere minutes.

If you're new to the Rift as I am, I highly recommend skipping this one until further notice.  If they ever patch the game to allow desktop mode, or simply allow the right thumbstick to control the camera from a first-person catwalk/platform, I'd give this game another shot-- until then, it's the perfect example of how one flaw can completely topple an entire VR game.

The game play and controls are good, and the environments are fun. The only issue I had was that it took me about 10 minutes to get used to the movement in the game, but after that I had a lot of fun with it. The animation and style of play reminds me of Mario 64.
This is a nice game!

Production on this games is superb, but such terrible camera work its like they totally ignored all Oculus advice for comfort in VR.
Why not have an option of a fixed camera? Instead a free game which I would have loved to play is DOA.

Please fix and give us options so we can actually enjoy it.

This is a straight clone of the old Sonic and Tales series of games. If you liked those, you'll like this. I'm not convinced being in VR adds anything to the experience since it's still a 3rd person game, but still, it's well executed. It plays well with both the xbox and touch controllers.

The only issue I have with it is the camera positioning is problematic at times. A chase cam would be much more useful than the side scroller style camera. This is especially true since it isn't a side scroller. Yes, you can move your head around, but this is clearly intended as a seated game, so your movement is limited.
Very fun game, not just for kids.

At 48 years old I considered myself past platformers as back in the day, thats all games were.  I started this up thinking "meh" I'll give it a go and oh my, I really liked it.

The colorful environments, the animation and the controlls were spot on.
I especially like the parts when our hero jumps down the rabit holes for the mini games, I thought it was a very nice touch.

My only wish for this title (and I'm sure it been said before) is for there to be way to pan the camera around with the right stick.

All in all though, this is a great game especially if you have any young'uns around, they will be quiet for hours in this game lol
Nice funny game but the perspective cam' is really uncomfortable...
It has it's moments but really I am not particularly engaged by this game. Good graphics, controls work well....game concept and gameplay, not blowing me away...but at least it was free.

This game is excellent. It's a great change of pace after playing more physically demanding games. It's a game you can sit down, relax and just play. The game is very similar in many aspects to Super Mario 3D world for the Wii U but it's better becuase its in VR! I could talk about all the things they could improve on, but at this point, I just want more VR platformers!

review_title: We need more games like this
one_reviews_text: This is the very first game we tried on the oculus and my son was like...oh my god.  Great game, lot of fun and i wish there was more game like this.  The game can be played with a gamepad but it is much better with the touch controllers. The only downside is that it seems we cannot control the camera. that would be a 5 stars if we could.
It is very "playful"! I had great pleasure... hope there will be an upgrade or even more stages !
I can't remember when I lat played a game that was this much fun, sequel please !!

It's a very nice game. It's the first time Iv'e felt as though I was on the platform with the character.
You can tell alot of time and thought went into this game. Very polished, two thumbs up on this one.

What a fantastic idea and art direction as well. It brings me back to classic n64 platformers, but unfortunately it stops at the art... If they could add a mode that would add a level of dificulty and competativeness this game could still be THE BEST game on the oculus market in my opinion. But the way you can walk through the levels with no effort destroys the experience for me. Please devs, I beg of you don't abandon this project. Make it open source, if you don't want to fix it. Their is a community that would gladly make gold out fo this.

It's a cool little platformer.  The story is fairy short and nothing deep but it does have it's charm.  It follows the roots of old school plaformers where you simply collect coins, jump, and puzzle solve.  The VR is well done and it's fun but nothing that really takes VR's potential to a new level. 3/5 recommended for a 1-time play-through.

review_title: Fairly standard game, but works well.
one_reviews_text:
Now, as a platformer game on its own, I'd say that Lucky's Tale doesn't exactly stand out from other platformers. The mechanics are a little shallow and the level design is good but not great. However, I really like the idea of having a platformer game in VR and I think it works pretty well, as having the extra depth perception really helps out with jumps.

I certainly want to see more platformers in VR, as I do enjoy this as a VR experience.
Gameplay is very good. The idea with using your head to shoot and move the camera works perfect! Played for a few hours in a row and no motion sickness whatsoever.

The way the ground moves around you gave me worst motion sickness I have yet had with any VR game..

Shame because it looks great, and gives nice new perspective to 3D platforming, but it just feels awful to play.
This is a really nice VR game, great the way it makes you feel like you're in the world.
This isn't frustrating platformer. It's very pleasant and fluid. Very good controls (xbox pad) Nice technology showcase. Play it!

review_title: The gameplay is comparable to Nintendont
one_reviews_text: The graphics are amazing in VR, but this game is all about the pleasure of controlling the character in the very well designed levels.
I install it many times, it always show installing ..downloading.. then stop, so I can't play it. What can I do?
Awesome!
So i was playing this game for about 10 minutes and what gave me the head ake is when  the camera follows the fox love the graphics tho i rate 4/5!

review_title: An excellent game to Start VR
one_reviews_text: If you're new to Rift, this is where you should begin.  This gives you the feel, graphics, and gameplay you need to start off correctly.

Polished and easy to play, a nice platform game in VR.
Great Fun.

review_title: Currently the Best Of it's Genre
one_reviews_text: Your Perspective is from a Camera floating above and behind the player you control, gamestyle ala Crash Bandicoot meets Banjo Kazooie. Still felt a bit wonky at times, not for me personally, if this was something more like Mario 64, I'd play it all day.
Good game, like a mario 64 knock off, but I got motion sickness really badly from the way the environment moves around me.
I felt like I was in the cartoon game. A lot of fun. Bright colours and a great virtual world.
its a 3d platformer, a little easy but with good lenght. but, not enough level thematics.
A Lot of detail was put into this game.  Plays flawlessly with the new touch controllers.
This is a blast! Has a 3d Sonic / Mario feel to it. Very fun!
I would have never thought that this could have been a reason to buy a Rift, but dang, it's absolutly amazing and would have bought a Rift just for this...
Really funny, great for young

review_title: We need more games like this!!
one_reviews_text: Proof that 3rd person platformers work perfectly in VR and the added immersion is amazing. Works great with the Touch controllers even

review_title: One of the Best VR experiences.
one_reviews_text: This plataform adventure game is amazingly fun. A must try for any body. Will not dissapoint even works with oculus touch.
One of the best VR games and this for FREE!
this is super mario 64 in VR. it's great, really, but also not a beginner game since if you're not used to VR motion sickness WILL kick in quite easily.
Great classic jump & run in VR. Lovely Graphics, Music and level design. love it.
Awesome
A well made game with very cute characters and cool jump'n'run action. I had to sit down for playing due to the camera movements though.
This Game is very nice in his catogory. End of the story.

review_title: What I would have loved as a Child
one_reviews_text: I really hope to seem more adventure games done like this.
Short and sweet!
Thank you oculus for making such great experiences !
Great game, reminded me of first time I played Sonic on the Mega Drive back in the 90's... It's really comfortable to play, no bugs at all, and the level design is really good.
Very good game, the best I've played in VR. Gameplay could have been better with more creativity into it.
The better game i've played in VR

It is visually stunning, makes full use of the headset and tracking, however it's not extremely original and I had VR sickness for a while due to the camera movements. I'd love to play more but I felt too dizzy and am not keen on getting back in there. But I do reccomend that you try this anyway, it is a beautiful game.
Very good graphics, very good feelings, very free. Just awesome, it deserves a big big thank you at least, it's surprisingly free.
Reminds me of Banjo Kazooie. Fun platformer that uses VR in a unique (non first person) kind of way. Great for all ages. However, it is a bit too easy for some.
Really nice platforming game, but it can get motion sick after a while.

A cool reinvention of jumping, spinning and dodging your way to victory. The game is much cooler in VR than you would guess by looking at it on a flat screen. The game is a good stepping stone to other games in terms of camera movement and fear of heights.

This easy to understand platformer is the perfect free solution to dive into VR. The levels get more challenging and every world adds new obstacles. The graphics are great. It reminds me of Super Mario 64 but could be a bit longer. But I won't complain because it's free, simply install it and have fun!
Great platform VR Title for any age!! It's a blast!

Amazing game, gameplay, everything is pretty cool.  Very enjoyable to play.
More, please!

Nice Game!!
I hope next version.
is great game!!!!!

Nintendo was sleeping on the job, and Mario met VR through a fox-like incarnation called Lucky.  The game plays very well, and could have been to Oculus what Mario 64 was to the Nintendo 64... if third person platformers had been to VR what they were to consoles.  

My chief complaint, which keeps me from giving it five stars, is that content seems gated after a certain point by requiring you to go back and accomplish various objectives within a stage to unlock later stages.
I am the man not a child but i am realy impressive! The scale, immersive... oh... every kid will love this game!
nice game!
good game thanks

Lucky's Tale is exactly the kind of game I would have played when I was a kid, and exactly the kind of game I would give to a kid to play. It's got all the classic trappings with coins, gems, hidden secrets, it feels like an old platformer in the same vein as Crash Bandicoot and the VR aspect of it creates a certain perspective of looking at a table full of miniatures that brings the charm to a whole new level. I love this game to death, which makes me so remarkably sad to have to knock a star off for the fact that I get some pretty heavy VR sickness when playing it to the point where I can't go much further than the second level. VR sickness is, thankfully, a highly subjective thing and your experience will vary. I strongly recommend giving it a chance at the very least to see if you can hold your stomach, because the raw whimsical charm of this title is well worth it.

If you grew up with a PS1 or a Nintendo 64 like me, you probably have played your share of 3D platformers. I loved the old collect-a-thon platformers from the early 3D days.

Lucky's Tale brings the classic 3D gameplay to the VR platform and it is executed really well.

You feel like you are looking at a little magical toy world and there is a lot of amazing details. If you put your head close to Lucky, he will wave at you.

Not only is the gameplay spot on but the soundtrack to this game is also really good. My favorite being the underwater level, really brings memories back to underwater levels from games like Donkey Kong Country and Mario 64.

I just hope we will see a sequel some day.
Great and Fun!

review_title: Makes me nauseous, too simple controls
one_reviews_text: Can't get anything out of it. It has some charme, but it has no interesting controls or diversity in it's gameplay. I can play it for around 10 minutes without having hour long nausea and 30 minutes wihout puking. Never did but close to. :D I am quite far into the game for these circumstances, level 4 if I remember correctly and I would have stopped there even if I wouldn't get sick from it. If you want a thrid-person game without nausea, play the great "Chronos".
Awesome work!
Ever
The best game I played in VR. I'm on a DK2 and graphics are crispy. Played the hell out of it: if you like platformers (and I even don't!), this game is simply amazing.
modern day version of sonic the hedgehog
probably the worst game i've ever played

This is a great VR experiance. It's like playing mario except that mario is physically there as a 4 inch tall animated fox and he's physically jumping around you. The level design is gorgeous, the soundtrack is excellent, IT'S FREE!!!!

Un jeu bien plus difficile qu'il n'y parait...
Univers vraiment sympa, et même si cela fait très "gamin" on a envie de voir la suite, pour un final vraiment top !
Un mario VR bien réussi graphiquement, bon jeu de plateforme !

I love this game. PSVR has something similar in their free app "The Playroom", but it's only 1 level and when I played it I thought I wish there was more.

Lucky's Tale is that more! It's a lot of fun. I love the bright colors, the music, the boss fight, and Lucky. I wouldn't say it is really difficult, but I died many times just being careless or impatient. I can't believe this was free. It was freaking awesome! Amazing game... Reminds me of the first time I played Crash Bandicoot on Playstation.

Mascot platformer with a lot of depth. Story mode is great for people new to games. The time trials are fun and challenging even for me as a seasoned gamer. There's something for everyone in this game. Sequel please!

This is the type of game that could have blown my mind away when I was a kid. The graphs are amazing. The interaction with the character gives you a sense of movement while exploring each world. This type of game reminds me a lot of Super Mario bro.

review_title: Easy, but a fun experience for VR
one_reviews_text: If you are accustomed to platformers you probably wont find this game challenging, but even so, it's a pretty cool experience and I hope more platformers follow this style in the future.
Great game I cant beleive it is free.

But it is actually a fun game, and a good example of what 3D platformers can be in VR. There are plenty of levels to entertain you, but somehow the depth perception doest fix my bad jumping in these games.
Similar to Mario 64 (and I would say "better than"), very relaxing. Good challenge, not too hard and fun enough. VR makes 3D platforming much more easy to control, thanks to depth perception.
its a easy game, but an fantastic experience for casual gamers, i will deffinetly buy the second ome if they make one.

In my eyes the gameplay of this game was a lot inspired by "Super Mario 3D Land", which does not mean it's a cheap rip-off. Quite the reverse! Gameplay is smooth and easy to control, maps and levels are colorful and interesting! Nothing wrong here!

review_title: Good platformer, but comfort is an issue
one_reviews_text:
Good platformer for kids (not too many clever platforming manuvers needed).
Gets a little uncomfortable to play after a while as to get the best out of the Headset you need to stand and look all over the place.  Platforming is good, and the story is all told visually and not reliant on text at all.  Recommended to show what Games can be in the future.
Love it! It's simple and fun to play.

This is what the oculus cv1 was made for one of the only games that stops me from selling my cv1 just quality from star to finish and i cannot understand why its free i would of paid £40 easy, keep up the good work and im hoping for a sequal.
Fairly easy 3D platform game.  Great artwork and animation.
Adorable spacious levels. Borrows heavily from Mario and that is fine with me. A great intro to 3rd person VR.

I am not really a Mario fan, but this gives me absolutly new experience to play such games. At the beginning feel a little discomfort when I run and jumb in the game, but soon get used to it. A little challenge, but not too hard. Kids love it!
Good platformer to get folks used to VR. Had my girlfriend play this game since EVE made her quite nauseous. She liked it alot.

Unremarkable, passable concept for a free bundled starter game, but does not showcase the possibilities VR facilitates.

The thumbstick-controlled camera is yet another textbook example of bad motion controls for VR.  The most blatant barf trigger happens when moving backwards -- instant intense vertigo, even with slow motion.  Game designers should avoid motion that creates conflicting signals for the vestibular system.  That this was the showcase launch title for the Rift launch magnifies this mistake.  Oculus should strive to set better examples.

Overall a fantastic little platformer, with loveable but generic critters. Colorful graphics & a great soundtrack are very pleasing to the eyes & ears. The VR & 3D aspect really immerses you in the little worlds. Fans of Mario, Spyro The Dragon, & the Crash Bandicoot series will appreciate the solid controls (works with Touch controllers as well) & the inspiration found here. It's short & sweet, but the game does get a tad repetative & their isnt anything ground breaking to be found here. I would really love to see Lucky return in a sequel as well as becoming the cute mascot for Oculus!

No clue why this isn't more heralded as it's like Crash meets Mario. The use of VR isn't heavy at first making it a nice intro to those who are new. My wife loves this and this and a few other apps have convinced someone who though VR was silly that it is a new medium. A perfect intro for the non-VR audience and the kid inside wanting to recapture the magic of Mario 64 as an adult.

I normally hate platform games and I am not very good at them but this is in a league of its own. Works perfectly in VR and actually uses the VR as part of the gameplay. Sadly lacking in some other titles. Very family friendly and easy to get into.

review_title: VR might be the revival of platform game
one_reviews_text: I'm impressed, I really didn't think that anything will make me like a platformer in this day and age. This brings back memories of old SNES/SEGA/PS plaformer games.  I want more of someting similar! Thanks for the expirience devs. :)

review_title: Seated game play at it's best
one_reviews_text: I love seated gameplay, and the graphics in this game is wonderful!

review_title: One of the Best Rift VR games ever...
one_reviews_text:
If you want to get a taste of what gaming in future might look like ... look no further. This game is amazing although some people don’t like the camera movement but I like it a lot and it is not the classic old way, it is a nice advancement on how to play this kind of games in future and of course you gonna have to get used to it but it is very smart and natural.
well done really.
please do yourself a favor, play this game and enjoy.

review_title: Please update with still camera option!
one_reviews_text: This is a charming game that controls well, and it really does feel like playing with a set of toys on a tabletop, through the lens of a child's imagination. Unfortunately, the roaming camera is immediately nauseating. I sincerely wish there were an option to play with a stationary camera, like the way CHRONOS works. I'd play this game all day if it didn't make me sick within minutes, and a stationary camera would work quite well with this level design. Hopefully someday!

I don't know where to start!! This game is incredibly amazing and well designed. I can't think of anything bad about it! I really enjoyed this game! The last boss fight was epic! The VR water effect in the caves is super cool. The music was catchy. The VR, depth and color palette are perfect. Thanks for the experience!! Make a sequel. If not, make a cart racing game featuring Lucky's Tale characters in VR on Oculus Rift!!! Game ran great on Titan X SLI config!

review_title: Pretty visuals but a bad VR title.
one_reviews_text: It's a pretty game that is sure to put most people off of the VR experience. Looking past the fact that most of the characters are bland and soulless (why am I being attacked by a smiling caterpillar with a thousand yard stare?), the camera movement really ruins this title. It's the kind of game where a staticly placed camera would work perfect. There's literally no need to slide around like a barfcoaster. I've found myself spending more time in the level select menu than anything else, looking around the island, seeing as it's really pretty and has tons of detail - and the camera is static so I don't get nauseous. As a showcase game, this is a pretty awful choice.
good gameplay and works great with touch
Between this game and Chronos, I have to say that third person VR experiences, contrary to everyone's expectations, are actually some of the best!

This game is the "Crash Bandicoot" of PSX for me, this show that 3rd person style game do work in VR, and not only work, but it is PHENOMENAL, i feel like a kid again playing this game. It is as if you are the guardian of lucky, a cute little character, you will feel so immersed inside of this cartoony world. The music also top notch ! can't get the music out of my head for so long. go grab this game. 

Will throw money for SEQUEL or DLC, or anything luckys tale related

review_title: it has a Fox thats it
one_reviews_text: well if i should give it a name you can call this crash bandifox with some changes it plays well and it is nice, but nothing i would realy buy for 20 bucks so 9,99 is still ok
Its free why not! fun little game to play.
The game controls well for what I played of it.  It made me very sick within minutes.
Add me lykantrus. Thanks
Reminds me of Sonic the Hedghog and Crash Bandicoot
I love it.
If you like platform games, you must try this one. It's the ultimate experience I had with that kind of game! Hoping there will be more like this.

Playing this game is like watching a viewmaster come to life.  It may be in my opinion one of the best demos of how VR can revolutionize standard gameplay.  In regards to the actual gameplay it is a good mario clone, but nothing more than that.

review_title: it can cause motion sickness very easily
one_reviews_text: It's a very pretty looking platformer and although it's fun to move the head around to look at things it would probably be just as fun as a regular (non VR) game. One thing to keep in mind is that the world moves beneath the player without any static point of reference so it's it can cause motion sickness very easily

Before this game I could not even imagine, a 3rd person VR game could work for me. But you made Lucky's Tale a perfect adaption of the jump n'run genre to VR. I definetly want to play more from you guys!
This game is beautiful. Really makes VR feel special. Even if you dont like mario type games, it is a beautiful world to interact with.

Lucky's Tale is a solid pack-in game that kind of feels like a 3D Mario game. The VR aspect makes you feel like you're in the world, and there are secrets hidden all over, encouraging you to move your head around and look for them.

This is a fun, but fairly short game. It's a little on the easy side too. It does have lots of goodies in each level and even has a time trial mode which really helps with replay value. Even if you're not a fan of platformers, at least try a level or two of this game as it costs nothing! If you do like platformers, you'll probably like Lucky's Tale.

review_title: Great visuals and potential, intense MS!
one_reviews_text: Luckeys Tale delivers an amazing art style and overall (Mario-like) experience to virtual reality. But in the end, the most people will struggle with the intense motion sickness due odd artificial cmaera movement. Handle with care!

Really reminded me of the awe I felt playing Mario 64 for the first time. Best 3rd person game I've played so far. It's neat to be able to just stand up look ahead at the rest of the level or peek around corners.
Playful Games made something amazing with Luckys Tale. Oculus would be missing out if they do not make this thier Mario. People should think Luckys Tale when they think Oculus

Being a seasoned gamer (wrong side of 50) I have always loved platform games, I`s say Lucky`s Tale is a instant classic and would say its the Sonic of VR, the only thing I found was it was to short of a game, but saying that it was free, hope to find Lucky`s Tale 2 or some DLC to buy soon Great stuff.

You sort of have to go with 5 stars for Lucky's Tale. It's a fun solid platformer made incredibly immersive by VR. This is one of my favourite games graphically, the artstyle and excellent AA/Supersampling make this one of the greatest looking games.
I've played through the campain and probably used twice again as much time trying to collect more gold paws and presents and I'm not done yet.

The perfect way to ease into Virtual Reality games.  Much work has been done to keep players from experiencing nausea, and that it is an adorable, fun--and at times challenging--platformer is really just icing on the cake.

This game is not only free (wich make it already worth at least a try) but is also really polished and extremely fun to play!
I literally divoured it, playing from start to end in one ride (3 hrs more or less and i played slow)
i'm giving 4 stars only for the lenght (too short abviously) but if it wasn't for that, it would have been 5 :)
TL:DR
Play it!
Awesome game! Very immersive, shows how amazing virtual reality is.  I delayed playing this game as I thought it would be silly, boy was I wrong.
An impressive platform adventure game that makes great use of the VR experience. The camera follow style feels good with no disorientation. Highly recommended.
If you enjoy games such as mario this will be right up your street

this is a wonderful and amazing looking introduction to virtual reality.  you totally are in the beautiful world as you make your way around it.  after you;ve playeed a game like this in VR..playing it the traditional computer moniter way seems unacceptable.
Works really decently and has a fun Mario-like vibe to it. But I haven't played it in quite some time so I can't give it full marks as it doesn't seem to lure me in anymore.

Quality game. Graphically impressive, tight controls, clean art style, smooth animations, good poverall presenation. The premise and gameplay is alot like Mario. But this  doesnt need to be a VR game. VR does not add to the gameplay mechanics in any meaningful way, so its not the best exemplar of this technology.
Fun and a worthwhile launch addition.
A thoroughly enjoyable cartoon platformer.  If you liked Mario 64 or Banjo-Kazooie you'll love this.  The VR is used in subtle ways to add depth to the game.
Probably one of the best VR games out there, and it's FREE??? Wow.. impressive.
I had fun beating this game.

I'm very weak for motion sickness and this game is almost unplayable for me. I'm really disapointed that devs don't undestand about motion sickness. After I played this game, I've decided to never buy games unless I can test it by demo.

I finally found a game that made me run upstairs, and bring the GF down to show her something that felt "right".. She loves the game, I think it's great.  I really would buy more VR games if they were done this well.

On a traditional 2D display, this game would vanish into obscurity by doing nothing new whatsoever, in a competent but unoriginal style. In VR however, it gives us a unique and engaging experience where you don't control the camera - you ARE the camera. Plus being able to see the depth clearly in stereo helps with making each jump accurately.

It's also refreshing to see a full, finished, polished and complete game at a time when most other offerings seem to be tech demos and limited content teasers.
Did not expect to love this game as much as I did.  It's on my "must own" list if you have an oculus.

review_title: Great game, especially as a starter.
one_reviews_text: Very fun old school game with a very new touch, reminded me of Spyro and Crash Bandicoot. Only downside is the preset angles can be a little wonky. Thumbs up to this one!
Would love to see more platformers like this come out.

review_title: this was a breath of fresh air.
one_reviews_text: This really caght me off guard. I didnt really know what to expect so i was blown away with in the first few seconds. This is VR at its finest!
This is a great intro game for those new to VR. Beautiful game :)
Must play if you own the Rift. It's basically Lucky is to Oculus as Mario is to Nintendo.
Must play game in oculus home and if play with 4K VR, you can find more fun.
First VR game that makes me think good product could be comming out.
I can't believe this game is free !
I like it

review_title: Best game on Rift hands down
one_reviews_text: This is the only game on rift I actually wanted to play and couldn't want to get back home to play.
Excellent platformer, reminiscent of Super Mario 64.
I have returned to SuperMario days when i first started playing nintendo :) this game is a must play !!!
Although it's 3rd person platformer, levels are considerately designed for VR.
